raw_comment:
There are a lot more players of color who are in these leagues but the head coaches percentages are significantly different and lower than the percentage of the players.

I wonder if the difference comes from the time span of the players and the coaches since they are very different. Since players in these categories have lower years played in the field than coaches because playing takes a giant toll on your body compared to coaching.

This impacts my community because New Hampshire is not a very diverse place. This impacts the judgment of us and how we view sports. There are some teams with a few people of color but it is mostly white.

“Diversity, seen on the field but not the sidelines.”

Coaching takes a smaller toll on a coach's body than playing takes on a player's body.
